Description: Neck and shoulder sherd of Attic black-figured pottery olpe; interior: glazed black on neck, reserved below; exterior black with reserved panel framed at top and side by brown line; black-figure decoration consisting of bridled horse's head (added red mane and forelock), to right.
Producer name: Attributed to a Follower of: The Gorgon Painter
Attributed to the Manner of: The Gorgon Painter
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Heidelberg 200 (ABV, 15, no. 29). For the subject, see the olpe, Louvre MNB 2035 (Beazley and Payne 1929, 254). See also the skyphos-krater by the Nessos Painter, Athens 16383 in Beazley, J. D., The Development of Attic Black-Figure, 2nd ed. Berkeley 1986, pl. 13.4.
Bibliographic references: Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 254, no. 2)
Payne 1931 / Necrocorinthia. A study of corinthian art in the archaic period (p. 193, pl. 53, no. 6)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 299, no. B289)
Venit 1984 / Early Attic Black Figure Vases in Egypt (p. 142-3)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 223, no. 8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0296) (Phase 1)
